Description:
Detects PowerShell commands that decrypt an ".LNK" "file to drop the next stage of the malware.

Author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: PowerShell Execution With Potential Decryption Capabilities
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((command like '%get-childitem %' or command like '%dir %' or command like '%gci %' or command like '%ls %') and (command like '%get-content %' or command like '%gc %' or command like '%cat %' or command like '%type %' or command like '%readallbytes%') and ((command like '% ^| %' and command like '%\*.lnk%' and command like '%-recurse%' and command like '%-skip %') and (command like '% -expandproperty %' and command like '%\*.lnk%' and command like '%writeallbytes%' and command like '% .length %')) and ((process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe') and (original_file_name = 'powershell.exe' or original_file_name = 'pwsh.dll')))
